summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 8476, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Woodland Park Avenue, in the City of Seattle, from Ewing Avenue to North Forty-fifth Street; and Whitman Avenue, in the City of Seattle, from Kilbourne Street to North Forty-fifth Street, by laying a water main of proper dimensions along said portions of said avenues, together with all necessary, crosses, tees, fire hydrants, and other appurtenances, under Resolution No. 169, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 said city, approved December 6, 1899."
